sentences.en: Abraham Maslow described psychology as "the science of being."
sentences.cn: 亚伯拉罕·马斯洛形容心理学是“存在的科学”。

sentences.en: British scientists have brought computer science to bear on this problem.
sentences.cn: 英国的科学家们已经应用计算机科学来解决这个问题。

sentences.en: He became world famous for his popularisation of science.
sentences.cn: 他因对科学知识的通俗化而闻名世界。

sentences.en: He devoted his energies to the reformation of science.
Interviewing politicians may not be rocket science, but it does matter.
sentences.cn: 采访政治家可能并不是什么高难度的事，但的确很重要。

sentences.en: Many leading scientists do not consider that science can give absolutely reliable knowledge.
sentences.cn: 许多杰出科学家都不认为科学能够提供绝对可靠的知识。

sentences.en: Oftentimes, these fossils are not made available to science at all.
sentences.cn: 科学界常常压根接触不到这些化石。

sentences.en: Physics isn't just about pure science with no immediate applications.
sentences.cn: 物理学并非只是一门不能直接运用的纯科学。

sentences.en: Science and technology have made major changes to the way we live.
sentences.cn: 科技极大地改变了我们的生活方式。

sentences.en: Science has determined that the risk is very small.
sentences.cn: 科学已经探明其危险性非常小。

sentences.en: Science may be able to provide some explanations of paranormal phenomena.
sentences.cn: 科学也许能够解释某些超自然现象。

sentences.en: She was Dean of the Science faculty at Sophia University.
sentences.cn: 她是上智大学科学院的院长。

sentences.en: The border between science fact and science fiction gets a bit fuzzy.
sentences.cn: 科学事实和科幻小说之间的界限变得有点儿模糊了。

sentences.en: The fear is that science could become the handmaiden of industry.
sentences.cn: 人们担心的是科学会成为工业的仆人。

sentences.en: the founder of modern science, Isaac Newton
sentences.cn: 现代科学创始人艾萨克·牛顿

sentences.en: They are crediting science with power it doesn't possess.
sentences.cn: 他们过分夸大了科学的力量。

sentences.en: This novel is not science fiction, nor is it Gothic horror.
sentences.cn: 这本小说既非科幻小说亦非哥特派恐怖小说。
